page.title: 12RESOURCES
page.content: INFORMATION SYSTEMS:There is no citizen's advice bureau.The local newspaper lists most information. This serves Bicester and the surrounding villages.The Police station is also a friendly, informative body.The offices of BRIC provide extra information. BRIC:The Bicester Resource Information Centre is a voluntary organisation, open daily.It deals with tax queries, social security, consumer advice, fair trading and accommodation.A solicitor is available once a fortnight for 1 hour -4x15minute appointments.Leaflets on general information may be obtained. GUIDE:An updated edition of the town guide may be purchased locally.It contains places of interest, general history and a town plan. LIBRARY:Built in 1965 in Old Place Yard it contains a wide selection of books.
